review: i completed full throttle a few times when it came out 30 years ago and this version is a nice way to play it today sometimes the background graphics look almost identical other times theyre pretty different especially vehicles which seem to use totally different 3d models and the widescreen aspect can affect a couple of puzzles the commentary tracks are a nice touch and i do still enjoy the game even if its a little short
game freezes all the time unplayable
a great remaster of a great game
very entertaining for a short time the character moved a bit slow in my opinion and sometimes its really hard to figure out what to do without a guide but the humor and music makes up for it

this is a nice remake the new graphics work well on widescreen setups but personally i dont like the new stylized filter look the good thing is you can actually change the graphics at any time and switch between the classic and the remake version  same with the control options  so if youre interested in a story about rock bikers and corporations you should give it a try
good game
its alright a maybe really good cartoony graphics great story but puzzles become a little bizarre as you progress

great throwback good audio va full widescreen its pretty cheap on sale too  so get it for that while on sale all these old pnc scumm games are available for free on a lot of different sites the old versions that are no longer in market but i got this just to play again and it comes w commentary
a good pointandclick adventure that falls short due to some remastering flaws and annoying design choices the audio is the best part especially the voice acting
short but very good game
great game
melhor jogo da histria passei horas na frente de um 486 jogando isso e pensar que vinha de brinde no kit multimedia da sond blaster junto com dark forces e cyberia

classic point n click and the remastered means its playable today great animation great story line great puzzles the only thing i didnt like so much was the skill andor timing based parts the driving parts were irritating slightly im into the pure point n click puzzle games and these features annoyed me slightly still got nearly 20 hours of fun out of it lucas arts knew how to do an adventure game would recommend day of the tentacle remastered also
i never liked you rip
good run down memory lane i wish kids now would enjoy these more
real fun game probably finished it in about mmm an hour ish but its great fun to replay again and again kind of like a really good movie
classic lucas arts a must play for any point n click fan
yeeeees
i played the game back in the nineties i think its nice they brought it back with new graphics
funny point  click game i played the remastered edition because classic looked really bad i havent played this game before so i guess that version is more for nostalgia
one hell of a game
a timeless classic dont be too hard on it its a 30 year old game the artwork and voice characterizations are comical and i have been entertained by this game time and time again

full throttle is a fun classic point and click with a charming story some moments feel a bit dated but nevertheless it was a quick fun game

its a lovely game

full throttle is a great and fun pointandclick game without that much moon logic it is worth it take time to read the end credits
masterpiece

among the old school games that got a remastered version this is one of the 3 old games that i most like and recommend remind me the first time i got a cdrom drive which today its not so used anymore  a great well done remastered made with love you can change the graphics to the old version with a button and see how it was back in the day comparing with the new version  truly a masterpiece   please buy it
im not putting my lips on that

did you play the original full throttle back in the day the remaster is worth it if youre new to this its cool game with the classic point and click style the story is rather short but its fun its a classic it embrasses and simultaneously makes fun of bikers its funny its over the top its full throttle   if youre unsure get it on sale and just enjoy a badass biker game

one of the best point and click games ever made   if you watch the trailer and get the biker gang vibe just play it its totally worth   nowdays some puzzles can fell hard but its the way those games are at that time

great remaster of a lucasarts classic while full throttle isnt as refined as games like day of the tentacle or sam and max hit the road full throttles plot is engaging and the game is just long enough for its runtime however gameplay can be a little awkward especially on your motorcycle but it may be better on a controller overall short but fun lucasarts game with a nice remaster im just hoping soon doublefine will remaster the dig
one of my favorite games of all time an absolute classic with iconic music so glad they did a remaster also i adore that mark hamill voice acted in this 3 1010 will keep replaying this game forever
great game glad to replay it after so many years
nice old game did not age very well especially the action section in the middle it is pretty terrible to be honest apart from that voice acting and animation is great

great remaster i enjoy the fact that the art stays true to the original
good flashback

a very wellmade remaster of one of the most iconic pointandclick adventures sadly i wont be able to finish  the game as the driving segments didnt age really well and were too difficultwonky for me  the new art fits the game very nicely and i can recommend this game to every fan of the genre who has a higher frustration tolerance than me when it comes to the nonpointandclickparts

if you played this in 1995 and have fond memories of it leave it in your memory definitely not the finest example from the 90s lucasarts point and click era which is a shame as so many great games were around back then  very short game with some frustrating parts to it the price at the time of writing this review is 1099 and i reckon it would take about 35 hours not great value for money
better off walkin

love the game not the crashes  game crashes a lot
short sweet and with fun little bonuses the concept art is amazing
a great update to a classic pnc
hell yeah

an interesting take on the lucasarts formula full throttle is a point and click adventure starring ben throttle a biker gang leader who witnesses the murder of the motorcycle ceo malcolm corley and goes off with his daughter maureen corley to stop adrian ripburger from taking over his company minivans arent cool after all and motorcycles are its a relatively shorter adventure compared to something like grim fandango but its worth the price on sale most certainly

blast from the past  i played this when it originally came out 30 years ago  love that this got a remaster and rerelease    pointandclick puzzle adventures were pretty popular at the time this was originally released but this one beat them all  with its humor vehicle mode and soundtrack this one was a great hit at the time  so excited to be able to play it again

great game easy gameplay and fun puzzles i liked it when it released the first time and was stoked to find it on here looked for it on a whim did a great job remastering it

an excellent remaster of a classic adventure game adventure games used to be so varied in their settings and i wish modern ones would take that into account many today are very focused on supernatural events which is fine but playing a badass biker in a puzzle based game is a great change of pace

ive enjoyed almost every lucasarts game but this aint it  some of the more interactive puzzles are a nightmare with unresponsive controls and weird physics  the scumm engine was not made for these types of puzzles  the remastered art is drab  everything looks blotchy and uninteresting  worldbuilding is nonexistent as the game drops you into oneanddone zones constantly

when this released back in the day i think it was my first point and click adventure game ever the cast the story the fun puzzlesthe remaster is perfect this game is awesome and i love it to this day one of my all time favorite games that realy made point and click adventures fun i wish we could have gotten more of this type of game grimm fandango  curse of monkey island
mostly good game the story is good slightly unclear on what to do at times

bfull throttle remasteredb is a great adventure game from the golden age of the 90s i never had the pleasure of playing this game back then even though i had the cd and im glad i played this remastered version first the story is short but memorable and the voice acting is excellent

its a tim schafer game that may be enough for you if not and youve played the original monkey island games you will know what is in store full throttle is set in an alternative version of the us it involves biker gangs and evil automobile company executives i usually play through it every few years or so with the remaster things look and sound better but it can be fun to flip back to the original graphics  highly recommend if youre a fan of the old lucasasarts games

good remaster for a good classic   one of the classic point and click games finally gets a remaster for the new operating systems the gameplay feels the same for better or worse the graphics are greatly improved with an option to change to the original settings  the sound has also improved but not as much as the graphics the game now has a starting menu that holds some new graphic arts achievements are also a nice addition   all in all a good port to new os with some new features
great game brings back good memories playing on my old packard bell dx also introduced me to the gone jackals

was a great quick trip down memory lane to relive this classic  highly recommend
